payload.content: Most AI agents currently struggle with integrating domain-specific knowledge and adapting to feedback, and simply adding retrieval, memory, or other engineering techniques is insufficient to resolve these issues.

name: Most AI agents currently struggle with integrating domain-specific knowledge and
content: Most AI agents currently struggle with integrating domain-specific knowledge and adapting to feedback, and simply adding retrieval, memory, or other engineering techniques is insufficient to resolve these issues.

payload.content: Agent builders must embrace feedback loops as an inevitability for creating continually learning, self-improving agents.

name: Agent builders must embrace feedback loops as an inevitability for creating cont
content: Agent builders must embrace feedback loops as an inevitability for creating continually learning, self-improving agents.

payload.content: Before building an AI agent, clearly define its end goal by identifying a specific business metric it aims to improve (e.g., retention, conversions, usage) to justify its existence and guide its development.

name: Before building an AI agent, clearly define its end goal by identifying a specif
content: Before building an AI agent, clearly define its end goal by identifying a specific business metric it aims to improve (e.g., retention, conversions, usage) to justify its existence and guide its development.

payload.content: Core theses for AI agents can be categorized by their primary objective: maximizing user engagement (e.g., consumer chat apps), maximizing tool queries (e.g., utilitarian/prosumer apps), or achieving user goals as fast as possible (e.g., customer support/success).

name: Core theses for AI agents can be categorized by their primary objective: maximiz
content: Core theses for AI agents can be categorized by their primary objective: maximizing user engagement (e.g., consumer chat apps), maximizing tool queries (e.g., utilitarian/prosumer apps), or achieving user goals as fast as possible (e.g., customer support/success).

payload.content: To improve an AI agent's performance, focus on collecting diverse and granular 'signals' that represent performance outcomes, rather than relying on simplistic feedback like 'thumbs up/down'.

name: To improve an AI agent's performance, focus on collecting diverse and granular '
content: To improve an AI agent's performance, focus on collecting diverse and granular 'signals' that represent performance outcomes, rather than relying on simplistic feedback like 'thumbs up/down'.

payload.content: Signals for AI agents do not have to be tied to a single chat; they can be long-term, such as daily or weekly chat counts or average weekly response times, especially if users are expected to engage with the product for extended periods.

name: Signals for AI agents do not have to be tied to a single chat; they can be long-
content: Signals for AI agents do not have to be tied to a single chat; they can be long-term, such as daily or weekly chat counts or average weekly response times, especially if users are expected to engage with the product for extended periods.

payload.content: Examples of engagement-maximizing signals for a single message include: time between agent and user response, whether the user left the chat, which follow-up question was clicked, and user sentiment (positive, negative, neutral).

name: Examples of engagement-maximizing signals for a single message include: time bet
content: Examples of engagement-maximizing signals for a single message include: time between agent and user response, whether the user left the chat, which follow-up question was clicked, and user sentiment (positive, negative, neutral).

payload.content: Relying on too few or 'bad' signals can lead to 'reward hacking' or 'reward overoptimization,' where an agent hyper-tunes to optimize a specific signal (e.g., response time) at the expense of overall user experience or other critical metrics like user sentiment, potentially leading to user churn.

name: Relying on too few or 'bad' signals can lead to 'reward hacking' or 'reward over
content: Relying on too few or 'bad' signals can lead to 'reward hacking' or 'reward overoptimization,' where an agent hyper-tunes to optimize a specific signal (e.g., response time) at the expense of overall user experience or other critical metrics like user sentiment, potentially leading to user churn.

payload.content: A critical task for an agent builder is to continuously identify new signals and evaluate the performance of existing ones.

name: A critical task for an agent builder is to continuously identify new signals and
content: A critical task for an agent builder is to continuously identify new signals and evaluate the performance of existing ones.

payload.content: Design the user interface (UI) of an AI agent to facilitate easy collection of user feedback and signals, as this is the highest leverage point for gathering good data.

name: Design the user interface (UI) of an AI agent to facilitate easy collection of u
content: Design the user interface (UI) of an AI agent to facilitate easy collection of user feedback and signals, as this is the highest leverage point for gathering good data.

payload.content: Cursor's success in integrating user feedback seamlessly with its tab feature serves as a model for how any agent builder should adopt the mental model of designing UIs for easy signal collection.

name: Cursor's success in integrating user feedback seamlessly with its tab feature se
content: Cursor's success in integrating user feedback seamlessly with its tab feature serves as a model for how any agent builder should adopt the mental model of designing UIs for easy signal collection.

payload.content: Examples of UI elements for signal collection include: a simple follow-up selector for chatbots, hyperlinks with link tracking for internal search agents, and features that allow seamless user feedback integration.

name: Examples of UI elements for signal collection include: a simple follow-up select
content: Examples of UI elements for signal collection include: a simple follow-up selector for chatbots, hyperlinks with link tracking for internal search agents, and features that allow seamless user feedback integration.

payload.content: An experiment's anatomy includes a control group (no changes), an experiment group (with changes like system prompt or new signal), and business metric tracking (optimizing towards specific signals).

name: An experiment's anatomy includes a control group (no changes), an experiment gro
content: An experiment's anatomy includes a control group (no changes), an experiment group (with changes like system prompt or new signal), and business metric tracking (optimizing towards specific signals).

payload.content: The UI design is crucial for signal collection, as a poorly designed interface will bottleneck the feedback process.

name: The UI design is crucial for signal collection, as a poorly designed interface w
content: The UI design is crucial for signal collection, as a poorly designed interface will bottleneck the feedback process.

payload.content: The most impactful method for improving AI agent response quality is to feed in good few-shot examples during generation time, leveraging a set of signals tuned to specific values on a per-response basis.

name: The most impactful method for improving AI agent response quality is to feed in
content: The most impactful method for improving AI agent response quality is to feed in good few-shot examples during generation time, leveraging a set of signals tuned to specific values on a per-response basis.

payload.content: When making a change in agent ranking, verify its effectiveness against a control group; otherwise, the change is akin to throwing darts randomly.

name: When making a change in agent ranking, verify its effectiveness against a contro
content: When making a change in agent ranking, verify its effectiveness against a control group; otherwise, the change is akin to throwing darts randomly.

payload.content: To build a feedback loop into an existing agent, analyze the codebase to understand business metrics and core theses, design a signal collection strategy (per-message, session-level, long-tail signals), implement signal capture hooks and storage, enhance the UI for passive signal collection, build a signal-derived response ranker, add an experimentation framework, and create monitoring and iteration tools.

name: To build a feedback loop into an existing agent, analyze the codebase to underst
content: To build a feedback loop into an existing agent, analyze the codebase to understand business metrics and core theses, design a signal collection strategy (per-message, session-level, long-tail signals), implement signal capture hooks and storage, enhance the UI for passive signal collection, build a signal-derived response ranker, add an experimentation framework, and create monitoring and iteration tools.

payload.content: An enhanced feedback loop for AI agents involves: processing a user query through an agent to generate output, grading the output with specific metrics (e.g., response time, user satisfaction, task completion), retrieving similar conversations from a vector database, and then reranking by quality signals to prioritize conversations that fulfill business needs.

name: An enhanced feedback loop for AI agents involves: processing a user query throug
content: An enhanced feedback loop for AI agents involves: processing a user query through an agent to generate output, grading the output with specific metrics (e.g., response time, user satisfaction, task completion), retrieving similar conversations from a vector database, and then reranking by quality signals to prioritize conversations that fulfill business needs.

payload.content: When implementing signal-derived rankers, experiment with different thresholds, the number of examples fed in (ideally up to 10), and the weighting of signals based on their importance to business needs.

name: When implementing signal-derived rankers, experiment with different thresholds,
content: When implementing signal-derived rankers, experiment with different thresholds, the number of examples fed in (ideally up to 10), and the weighting of signals based on their importance to business needs.

payload.content: To ensure changes to an AI agent's output logic are effective, run experiments (e.g., A/B tests) comparing a control group to an experiment group, tracking specific business metrics, with experiments potentially running for days to weeks depending on usage.

name: To ensure changes to an AI agent's output logic are effective, run experiments (
content: To ensure changes to an AI agent's output logic are effective, run experiments (e.g., A/B tests) comparing a control group to an experiment group, tracking specific business metrics, with experiments potentially running for days to weeks depending on usage.

payload.content: Define clear business outcomes for agents, such as retention, specific feature activation, user happiness, or likelihood to recommend.

name: Define clear business outcomes for agents, such as retention, specific feature a
content: Define clear business outcomes for agents, such as retention, specific feature activation, user happiness, or likelihood to recommend.
